trans-unit.source: Defines the methods, properties, and events common to all HTML server controls in the ASP.NET page framework.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> class provides common properties inherited by all HTML server control classes.
A new instance of the class is not created directly.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl"></xref> class using default values.
This constructor is used to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> class using default values.
A new instance of this class is not created directly.
This constructor is called from the constructor of other HTML control classes to initialize properties defined in this class.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl>.
Property
Initial Value
The "span" literal string.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl"></xref> class using the specified tag.
This constructor is used to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> class using the specified tag.
A new instance of this class is not created directly.
This constructor is called from the constructor of other HTML control classes to initialize properties defined in this class.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl>.
Property
Initial Value
The value of the `tag` parameter.
A string that specifies the tag name of the control.
Gets a collection of all attribute name and value pairs expressed on a server control tag within the ASP.NET page.
Use this property to programmatically access the attributes of the HTML server control.
All HTML server controls store their attributes in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
HTML attributes are treated by the .NET Framework as properties on the HTML server control to which they belong.
For additional information on the attributes collection, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.AttributeCollection?displayProperty=fullName> class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.AttributeCollection"></xref> object that contains all attribute name and value pairs expressed on a server control tag within the Web page.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object to hold the child controls (both literal and server) of the server control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object to contain the current server control's child server controls.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the HTML server control is disabled.

In the browser, a disabled element or control is read-only, with the following added restrictions: its value is not submitted with the form, the element or control cannot receive focus, and the element or control is skipped when navigating the document by tabbing.
`true` if the control is disabled; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Gets the value of the named attribute on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl"></xref> control.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.GetAttribute%2A> method to access an attribute on the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> server control.
All HTML server controls store their attributes in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
HTML attributes are treated by the ASP.NET page framework as properties on the HTML server control to which they belong.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.GetAttribute%2A> method's `name` parameter is case-insensitive.
The name of the attribute.
This argument is case-insensitive.
The value of this attribute on the element, as a <xref href="System.String"></xref> value.
If the specified attribute does not exist on this element, returns an empty string ("").
Writes content to render on a client to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.Render%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.RenderBeginTag%2A> method and passes the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that contains the output stream to render on the client.
Renders the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl"></xref> control's attributes into the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.RenderAttributes%2A> method writes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A?displayProperty=fullName> attribute of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.RenderAttributes%2A> method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that receives the rendered content.
Renders the opening HTML tag of the control into the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.RenderBeginTag%2A> method renders the opening angle bracket (\<), followed by the control's tag name, attributes, and a closing angle bracket (>).

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.RenderBeginTag%2A> method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that receives the rendered content.
Sets the value of the named attribute on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl"></xref> control.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.SetAttribute%2A> method to set an attribute on the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> server control.
All HTML server controls store their attributes in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
HTML attributes are treated by the ASP.NET page framework as properties on the HTML server control to which they belong.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.SetAttribute%2A> method's `name` parameter is case-insensitive.
The name of the attribute to set.
The value to set the attribute to.
Gets a collection of all cascading style sheet (CSS) properties applied to a specified HTML server control in the ASP.NET file.
Use this property to programmatically access the style properties of the HTML server control.
For additional information on the CSS style collection, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection?displayProperty=fullName> class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection"></xref> object that contains the style properties for the HTML server control.
Gets the element name of a tag that contains a `runat=server` attribute and value pair.
Use this property to programmatically determine the element name of the HTML server control.
For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.TagName%2A> property of the server-side `<div id="myDiv" runat=server>` element contains the value "div".
The element name of the specified tag.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl"></xref> view state is case-sensitive.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.ViewStateIgnoresCase%2A> property overrides the base class's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewStateIgnoresCase%2A> property to always return `true`, indicating that the controls that inherit from <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> save view state without taking case into account.
`true` in all cases.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor.GetAttribute(System.String)"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.System%23Web%23UI%23IAttributeAccessor%23GetAttribute%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.GetAttribute%2A> method.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor> interface.
The attribute name.
The value of this attribute on the element, as a <xref href="System.String"></xref> value.
If the specified attribute does not exist on this element, returns an empty string ("").
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor.SetAttribute(System.String,System.String)"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.System%23Web%23UI%23IAttributeAccessor%23SetAttribute%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.SetAttribute%2A> method.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor> interface.
The name of the attribute to set.
The value to set the attribute to.
